title: Add/Hide Columns in the AE-Specific Tables
text: Building interactive AE forest plots starts constructing metadata. detailed procedure building metadata covered vignette Generate Interactive AE Forest Plots Drill AE Listing. Therefore, vignette, skip details directly use metadata created .
code: adsl <- forestly_adsl adae <- forestly_adae  adsl$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") ) adae$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adae$TRTA,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") )  meta <- meta_adam(population = adsl, observation = adae) |>   define_plan(plan = plan(     analysis = "ae_forestly",     population = "apat",     observation = "apat",     parameter = "any;drug-related"   )) |>   define_analysis(name = "ae_forestly", label = "Interactive Forest Plot") |>   define_population(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA", id = "USUBJID",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_observation(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "any",     subset = NULL,     label = "Any AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "drug-related",     subset = toupper(AREL) == "RELATED",     label = "Drug-related AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   meta_build()

what: Step 2: customize the AE specific columns
title: Add/Hide Columns in the AE-Specific Tables
text: Users can tailor AE-specific columns specifying display = ... argument within format_ae_forestly() function. available options follows: "n": Displays column number subjects experiencing AEs. "prop": Displays column proportion subjects experiencing AEs. "diff": Displays column showing difference AE proportions arms. "fig_prop": Displays column visualizing AE proportions. "fig_diff": Displays column visualizing differences AE proportions arms. "total": Displays column reporting pooled results control experimental arms. default, display = c("n", "prop", "fig_prop", "fig_diff") used, includes: (1) number subjects AEs arm, (2) AE proportion arm, (3) visualization AE proportions, (4) visualization AE proportion differences. example , demonstrate add total column alongside default display settings.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(display = c("n", "prop", "fig_prop", "fig_diff", "total")) |>   ae_forestly()

title: Personalized Color Choices in Data Visualization
text: Building interactive AE forest plots starts constructing metadata. detailed procedure building metadata covered vignette Generate Interactive AE Forest Plots Drill AE Listing. Therefore, vignette, skip details directly use metadata created .
code: adsl <- forestly_adsl adae <- forestly_adae  adsl$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") ) adae$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adae$TRTA,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") )  meta <- meta_adam(population = adsl, observation = adae) |>   define_plan(plan = plan(     analysis = "ae_forestly",     population = "apat",     observation = "apat",     parameter = "any;drug-related"   )) |>   define_analysis(name = "ae_forestly", label = "Interactive Forest Plot") |>   define_population(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA", id = "USUBJID",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_observation(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "any",     subset = NULL,     label = "Any AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "drug-related",     subset = toupper(AREL) == "RELATED",     label = "Drug-related AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   meta_build()

title: Personalized Color Choices in Data Visualization
text: Users can specify custom colors using color = ... argument within format_ae_forestly() function. default, color scheme based branding Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA. example , modify colors c("black", "grey60", "grey40") represent three arms plot. default color palette supports 4 arms; studies 4 arms, recommend users define color settings ensure clear visualization.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(color = c("black", "grey60", "grey40")) |>   ae_forestly()

title: Legend Customization in AE Proportion Difference Visualizations
text: Building interactive AE forest plots starts constructing metadata. detailed procedure building metadata covered vignette Generate Interactive AE Forest Plots Drill AE Listing. Therefore, vignette, skip details directly use metadata created .

what: Step 2: customize the legend below the column of AE proportions differences
title: Legend Customization in AE Proportion Difference Visualizations
text: Users can modify legend AE proportion difference specifying diff_label = ... argument within format_ae_forestly() function. default setting diff_label = "Treatment <- Favor -> Placebo". example , show change legend text. encourage users tailor label best reflect context specific study.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(diff_label = "New Drug <- Favor -> SoC", ) |>   ae_forestly()

title: Adjusting Decimal Precision in Displayed Data
text: Users can adjust decimal precision specifying digits = ... argument within format_ae_forestly() function. default, digits = 1 set, displaying values one decimal place. example , demonstrate increase two decimal places.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(digits = 2) |>   ae_forestly()

code: adsl <- forestly_adsl adae <- forestly_adae  adsl$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") ) adae$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adae$TRTA,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") )  meta <- meta_adam(population = adsl, observation = adae) |>   define_plan(plan = plan(     analysis = "ae_forestly",     population = "apat",     observation = "apat",     parameter = "any;drug-related"   )) |>   define_analysis(name = "ae_forestly", label = "Interactive Forest Plot") |>   define_population(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA", id = "USUBJID",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_observation(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "any",     subset = NULL,     label = "Any AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "drug-related",     subset = toupper(AREL) == "RELATED",     label = "Drug-related AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   meta_build()

what: Step 2: customize the AE listing columns
title: Selecting Columns to Display in AE Listings
text: Users can specify AE listing columns using ae_listing_display = ... argument prepare_ae_forestly() function. columns displayed AE listing correspond variables provided ae_listing_display = ..... following example, select unique subject ID, site number, gender, race, age, listing display five variables.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly(ae_listing_display = c("USUBJID", "SITEID", "SEX", "RACE", "AGE")) |>   format_ae_forestly() |>   ae_forestly()

title: Toggle Risk Difference Columns in the AE-Specific Tables
text: Users can control display risk difference columns using display_diff_toggle = ... argument ae_forestly() function. example , enable risk difference toggle button setting display_diff_toggle = TRUE. adds interactive “Show/Hide Risk Difference” button table, allowing users dynamically show hide risk difference related columns, including difference values (diff) risk difference visualization (fig_diff).
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(display = c("n", "prop", "fig_prop", "fig_diff", "diff")) |>   ae_forestly(display_diff_toggle = TRUE,               display_soc_toggle = TRUE)

text: Building interactive AE forest plots starts constructing metadata. detailed procedure building metadata covered vignette Generate Interactive AE Forest Plots Drill AE Listing. Therefore, vignette, skip details directly use metadata created .

title: Adjusting Column Widths for Optimal Layout
text: Users can control column widths using following arguments: width_term = ...: Sets width (pixels) column displaying AE preferred term. width_fig = ...: Sets width (pixels) column displaying AE proportions differences visually. width_n = ...: Sets width (pixels) columns reporting numerical counts subjects AE term (“N” columns). width_prop = ...: Sets width (pixels) columns reporting numerical AE proportions (“(%)” columns). width_diff = ...: Sets width (pixels) columns reporting numerical AE proportion differences. footer_space = ...: Sets vertical space (pixels) legend bottom AE-specific table. example , modify column widths better suit display. Users encouraged adjust widths optimize table layout preferred screen size readability.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(     width_term = 5, # width of the column of AE PT term     # widths of the column of subject with AE counts     width_n = 2,     # widths of the column of AE proportions     width_prop = 2,     # widths of plotting the AE proportions and differences     width_fig = 150,     # vertical space between legend and the table     footer_space = 100   ) |>   ae_forestly()

what: Step 2: customize limits for AE proportion/difference plotting
title: Customizing Plot Limits for AE Proportions and Differences
text: Users can control limits specifying prop_range = ... diff_range = ... arguments within format_ae_forestly() function. Specifically, prop_range sets limits AE proportions, diff_range defines limits AE proportion differences confidence intervals. default, limits set based minimum maximum values observed across AEs, rounded extended ±2 units better visualization. example , modify AE proportion limits range -0.5 30, AE proportion difference limits -10 35. Please note specified range fully encompass observed minimum maximum values, warning message displayed.
code: meta |>   prepare_ae_forestly() |>   format_ae_forestly(prop_range = c(-0.5, 30), diff_range = c(-10, 35)) |>   ae_forestly()

title: Design Plan of the forestly Package
text: forestly package developed generate interactive forest plot safety analysis clinical trials. generate interactive forest plot, develop three main functions listed . details three main functions introduced next three sections separately. tidy_ae_table: function used obtain adverse event (AE) information ready visualization. download_ae_reports: function used generate download button, users can download AE summary tables clicking button. forestly: function used generate interactive forest plot. minimal example summarized major steps using forestly package
code: mydata <- tidy_ae_table(...)    # Step 1: create tidy AE data download_ae_reports(mydata)     # Step 2: generate download button forestly(mydata)                # Step 3: generate interactive forest plot                                 # (the order of Step 2 and Step 3 can be reversed)

title: Design Plan of the forestly Package
text: main function tidy_ae_table() used obtain AE information ready visualization. Specifically speaking, merges standardized adsl adae tables together, outputs AE summary table. AE summary table summarizes number/ratio subjects experiencing certain AE treatment arm control arm. utility functions developed inside tidy_ae_table() list follows. tidy_population(): function used prepare observation datasets use function tidy_ae_table(). function filter adsl dataset, define proper treatment order dataset. tidy_observation(): function used prepare observation datasets use function tidy_ae_table(). function filter adae dataset, define proper treatment order dataset. `prop_test_mn(): function tests equal proportion using Miettinen Nurminen method. forestly package, generates confidence interval (CI) risk difference treatment arm control arm. define_ae_selectList(): function specify AE labels displayed select list interactive forestly plot. two arguments, (1) ae_criterion (2) ae_label. first argument ae_criterion (vector ) string, defines criterion select class AE display interactive forest plot. example, ae_criterion = 'AESER == "Y"', select serious AE. second argument ae_label (vector ) string, defines labels displayed select list interactive forest plot. two arguments string vectors, must 1:1 map. function used arguments ae_interested = function tidy_ae_table() (see examples ). throws errors length ae_criterion doesn’t match ae_label. tidy_multi_ae_label(): function design rbind data together according interested AE labels defined ae_interested =. example, use Example 1 , tidy_multi_ae_label() generate AE summary table rbind(summary table AE, summary serious AE). tidy_ae_listing(): function generates data frame serves listed details reactable.
code: # Example 1: if you would like to display the serious AE tidy_ae_table(...,               ae_interested = define_ae_selectList(ae_criterion = 'AESER == "Y"',                                                    ae_label = "serious AE"),               ...).  # Example 2: if you would like to display both serious AE and drug-related AE tidy_ae_table(...,               ae_interested = define_ae_selectList(ae_criterion = c('AESER != "N"', 'AEREL != "None"'),                                                    ae_label = c("serious AE", "drug-related AE")               ...).

title: Design Plan of the forestly Package

Example: https://merck.github.io/r2rtf/articles/example-ae-summary.html tlf_ae_specific: function create specific AE table. tlf_ae_listing: function create AE listing. output tlf_xxx functions r2rtf objects created rtf_encode tlf_download: function download multiple TLFs Rmarkdown. Rewrite ae_download_report allow use tlf_xxx functions input.
code: tlf_ae_summary()   # generate the AE summary table tlf_ae_specific()  # generate the specific AE table # tlf[[4]] <- tlf_ae_listing()   # As needed ????  tlf_download()    # download the above tables

title: Design Plan of the forestly Package
text: function generates interactive forest plot returned objected tidy_ae_table(). interactive forstly plot, consists two blocks. first block select list. items listed select list specified ae_label = function tidy_ae_table(..., ae_interested = , ...). clicking different AE labels, different reactable generated. example, click “serious AE”, reactable display serious AE summary table. main tool develop block crosstalk::filter_select(). second block reactable. reactable summarizes AE information selected AE label. main tool develop block reactable::reactable(). utility functions used develop forestly() listed follows. forestly_design_details(): function returns design details reactable forest plot, including design details cell two proportions; design details cell CI; design details footer two proportions; design details footer CI. design details returned another utility function sparkline_point_js(), introduce details later. generate design details, users need specify elements design, including color: color two proportion/CI plot (see arguments fig_prop_color = fig_diff_color =); label: labels displayed two proportion/CI plot (see arguments fig_prop_label = fig_diff_label =); column width: column width two proportion/CI plot (see arguments fig_prop_colwidth = fig_diff_colwidth =); range: x-axis range plot two proportion/CI plot (see arguments fig_prop_range = fig_diff_range =). sparkline_point_js(): function generates Javascript rendered. used design details reactables, including cell footer. dependence files path forestly/inst/js/sparkline.js. mk_reactable(): function used create data table tabular data sorting pagination default. Essentially, wrapper function reactable() robust BAAMR usage. dependence R package reactable.

title: Generate Interactive AE Forest Plots with Drill Down to AE Listing
text: forestly R package creates interactive forest plots clinical trial analysis reporting. interactive forest plots include: - AE-specific tables along AE proportion difference confidence interval visualized. - AE listing tables corresponding selected AE. interactive features, users can: - Search AE PT term SOC term interest. - Filter AEs incidence greater specified percentage one arms. - Sort AEs smallest proportion proportion difference largest. - Switch different AE-specific tables. - Drill listings subjects selected AE.

text: example presented vignette, utilize ADAM data forestly R package. factorize actual arm variable, TRTA, enable forestly R package identify arm serves reference group.
code: library(metalite) library(forestly)  adsl <- forestly_adsl adae <- forestly_adae  adsl$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") ) adae$TRTA <- factor(forestly_adae$TRTA,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") )

previous_headings: Procedure to generate interactive forest plot
title: Generate Interactive AE Forest Plots with Drill Down to AE Listing
text: use metalite R package generate minimal metadata generation interactive forest plot. begin, input adsl data population data adae data observation data. Without loss generality, plan generate following four AE-specific tables: AE (give short name/nickname "") Drug-related AE (give short name/nickname "drug-related") Serious AE (give short name/nickname "serious") Drug-related serious AE (give short name/nickname "drug-related-serious") However, users allowed add AE-specific tables needed. 4 AE specific tables, take APaT observation observation. Following definition analysis plan, specify details analysis = "ae_forestly" providing label display. define related population (population = "apat") observation (observation = "apat") specifying grouping variable (group = ...), subject ID (id = ...), population flag (subset = ...) label (label = ...). users wish use different population flags, grouping variables, labels, can make changes needed. Next, specify details parameter = ";drug-related;serious;drug-related-serious". AEs (""), filter applied. drug related AEs ("drug-related"), filter AEREL %% c("PROBABLE", "POSSIBLE"). Similarly, define serious AE drug related serious AEs. Finally, build metadata running meta_build() function.
code: meta <- meta_adam(population = adsl, observation = adae) meta <- meta |>   define_plan(plan = plan(     analysis = "ae_forestly",     population = "apat",     observation = "apat",     parameter = "any;drug-related;serious;drug-related-serious"   )) meta <- meta |>   define_analysis(name = "ae_forestly", label = "Interactive Forest Plot") meta <- meta |>   define_population(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA", id = "USUBJID",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) |>   define_observation(     name = "apat", group = "TRTA",     subset = SAFFL == "Y", label = "All Patient as Treated"   ) meta <- meta |>   define_parameter(     name = "any",     subset = NULL,     label = "Any AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) meta <- meta |>   define_parameter(     name = "drug-related",     subset = toupper(AREL) == "RELATED",     label = "Drug-related AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) meta <- meta |>   define_parameter(     name = "serious",     subset = AESER == "Y",     label = "Serious AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "drug-related-serious",     subset = AESER == "Y" & AEREL %in% c("PROBABLE", "POSSIBLE"),     label = "Drug-related serious AEs",     var = "AEDECOD", soc = "AEBODSYS"   ) meta <- meta |> meta_build()

title: Format outdata for interactive forest plot — format_ae_forestly
text: outdata outdata object created prepare_ae_forestly(). display character vector measurement displayed. n: Number subjects AE. prop: Proportion subjects AE. total: Total columns. diff: Risk difference. digits number digits decimal point displayed proportion risk difference. width_term Width px AE term column. width_fig Width px proportion risk difference figure. width_n Width px "N" columns. width_prop Width px "(%)" columns. width_diff Width px risk difference columns. footer_space Space px footer display legend. prop_range vector lower upper limit x-axis proportion figure. diff_range vector lower upper limit x-axis risk difference figure. color vector colors analysis groups. Default value supports 4 groups. ae_col_header Column header adverse events item columns. NULL (default) "par" specified components prepare_ae_forestly(), uses "Adverse Event". NULL "soc" specified components prepare_ae_forestly(), uses "System Organ Class" "soc". diff_label x-axis label risk difference. diff_col_header Column header risk difference table columns. NULL (default), uses "Risk Difference (%)  vs. Reference Group". diff_fig_header Column header risk difference figure. NULL (default), uses "Risk Difference (%) + 95% CI  vs. Reference Group".

title: Plot to display risk difference — plot_errorbar
text: tbl data frame selected input data set display plot. y x variables required. ci_cols character vector columns risk difference used plot. Need 3 columns, risk difference, lower bound, upper bound. y_var character string specifies variable displayed y-axis. errbar_width numeric value define error bar width. Default 0.4. Value argument half length error bar, example, errorbar_width = 0.2 means half error bar width 0.2 unit length. y = 4, error bar range y = 3.8 y = 4.2. color Color treatment group. shape Shape treatment group. Default circle square. Input values either character numeric value, details, see https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/articles/ggplot2-specs.html. label character vector labels treatment group. control group label specified last element vector. x_breaks numeric vector x-axis breaks. Default NULL, uses default ggplot2 x-axis breaks presentation. grp_abbrev character vector displaying treatment groups favor bar. grp_abbrev = "paired", treatment label error bar label argument. grp_abbrev = "none", error bar shown. Also, customized terms, users can provide alternative vector treatment labels. Default "paired". favor_direction position favor label condition "comparison treatment – control". AEs, favor_direction "negative"; efficacy, favor_direction "positive". vline Vertical reference line position. Default NULL. Users can define one multiple numeric values vector reference line position. line_type Reference line type. Default solid line. Users can define one multiple line types vector (can numeric 1, 2, 3 character "solid", "dashed"). values recycled order consistent argument vline. title Plot title. Default "Risk Diff. + 95% CI \\n (Percentage Points)". background_color Plot background color. Default c("#69B8F7", "#FFFFFF"), pastel blue white. value argument used input background_color argument background_panel(). background_alpha Opacity background. Default 0.3. value argument input background_alpha argument background_panel(). theme Panel theme, including y-axis text, ticks, plot margin. Default theme_panel(show_text = TRUE, show_ticks = TRUE). details, refer theme_panel. legend_nrow Integer, number rows legend display. Must smaller equal number treatment groups. omit legend, set NULL. Default 1.

title: Output static forest plot — rtf_static_forestly
code: forestly_adsl$TRTA <- factor(   forestly_adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") ) forestly_adae$TRTA <- factor(   forestly_adae$TRTA,   levels = c("Xanomeline Low Dose", "Placebo"),   labels = c("Low Dose", "Placebo") ) outdata <- meta_forestly(   dataset_adsl = forestly_adsl[1:40, ],   dataset_adae = forestly_adae[1:40, ] ) |>   prepare_ae_forestly()|>   format_ae_forestly()  p1 <- substitute(   plot_dot(     tbl,     prop_cols = c("prop_1", "prop_2"),     y_var = "name",     label = c("Treatment", "Placebo")   ) ) p2 <- substitute(   plot_errorbar(     tbl,     ci_cols = c("diff_1", "lower_1", "upper_1"),     y_var = "name",     label = c("Treatment", "Placebo"),     legend_nrow = NULL,     theme = theme_panel(show_ticks = FALSE, show_text = FALSE)   ) ) p3 <- substitute(   table_panel(     tbl,     n_cols = c("n_1", "n_2"),     prop_cols = c("prop_1", "prop_2"),     y_var = "name",     theme = theme_panel(show_ticks = FALSE, show_text = FALSE),     x_label = c("Treatment \n n(%)", "Placebo \n n(%)")   ) ) outdata |> rtf_static_forestly(   plot_calls = c(p1, p2, p3),   source = "Source:  [CDISCpilot: adam-adsl; adae]",   path_outdata = tempfile(fileext = ".Rdata"),   path_outtable =  tempfile(fileext = ".rtf") ) #> The outdata is saved in /tmp/Rtmp2lb3o5/file1b614a45773a.Rdata #> The output is saved in /tmp/Rtmp2lb3o5/file1b613023650c.rtf

title: forestly 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2025-09-10

title: forestly 0.1.3
text: rtf_static_forestly() now available generating static forest plots RTF format (#60). Add data source script data-raw/forestly_adae.R (#72). Add prop_range diff_range arguments format_ae_forestly() allow control x-axis limits AE proportion risk difference plots (#80). Add col_header fig_header arguments format_ae_forestly() enable customizable column figure headers risk difference outputs (#96). Add filter_range argument ae_forestly() flexible slider range customization (#97).

title: forestly 0.1.3
text: Fix bug correctly pass digits display format column format_ae_forestly() make number displayed decimal places proportions risk differences user-configurable (#90). Fix bug “n” “(%)” columns output table displayed specified display format_ae_forestly() (#95)

title: forestly 0.1.3
text: Update format_ae_listing() consistently use list-style indexing (res[[“column”]]) instead dollar-sign notation (res$column) accessing data frame columns (#71). Reorganize pkgdown site structure (#81, #82, #85) Update format_ae_listing() replace direct use tools::toTitleCase() new helper function titelcase() case SEX input data factorized (#92). Update format_ae_forestly() ensure consistency order treatment groups across tables figures (#94).

title: forestly 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-10 Fix bug prevents reactable rendering reactR >= 0.6.0 (#67). Add new argument filter_label ae_forestly() controlling slider bar label (#68).

title: forestly 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-08 Add button display SOC column subset. Refine default value meta_forestly(). Update format_ae_listing() better aligned oncology AEs reporting. Enhance functionality related drill-listing. Inherit paramter_term parameters metadata default (#20). Allow user specify treatment group (#15). Add warning using tibble input (#17). Fix bug record selected AE category (#9). Fix bug multiple plots displayed one page (#12). Update dataset forestly_adae since variable factor unexpected.

title: forestly 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-07-19 Initial version. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
